feature.name: Mood-to-Visual Mapper
feature.description: Translates semantic analysis output into visual parameters (colors, intensity multipliers). Maps mood/sentiment to color palettes and intensity modifiers for the visualizer.

tests.description: Mapper accepts mood object from semantic pipeline
Mapper outputs color palette (primary, secondary, accent colors)
Mapper outputs intensity modifier (0.5 to 1.5 multiplier)
Positive sentiment maps to warm/bright colors
Negative sentiment maps to cool/muted colors
High energy maps to increased intensity modifier
Mapper interpolates smoothly between mood changes (no jarring shifts)
Mapper provides suggested primitive weights (which to emphasize)
Mapper exposes current state for external access

priorDecisions: MoodObject contains: sentiment (-1 to 1), energy (0 to 1), keywords (top 5), emotion
Visual direction: lo-fi, warm, a little weird - roughness is feature
Use HSL color space for easier mood mapping
context.notes: Mapper should provide smooth interpolation between mood changes to avoid jarring visual shifts
